items.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
items.summary: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

items.title: Calvert-Lewin scores twice as Leeds thrash Crystal Palace
items.summary: Dominic Calvert-Lewin extends his scoring streak to five Premier League games with a superb double as Leeds United secure a comfortable victory over Crystal Palace at Elland Road.

items.title: Williamson drops Simpson four times in stoppage win
items.summary: Troy Williamson upsets the odds to stop Callum Simpson in brilliant fashion and win the British, Commonwealth and European super-middleweight titles.

items.title: Isak injury in chaotic Liverpool win gives Slot more problems
items.summary: Liverpool stretch their unbeaten run to six games but Alexander Isak's injury while scoring overshadows win at Tottenham.

items.title: Gyokores penalty sends Arsenal top of the table in win against Everton
items.summary: Arsenal striker Viktor Gyokores' first-half penalty sends the Gunners to the top of the Premier League table in win over Everton.

items.title: Wyatt beats GB team-mate Weston to World Cup gold
items.summary: Great Britain's Marcus Wyatt beats team-mate Matt Weston to World Cup gold in the men's skeleton in Sigulda, Latvia, while Zoe Atkin claims halfpipe gold in Colorado.

items.title: Romero wouldn't have seen red if referee 'did his job' - Frank
items.summary: Cristian Romero would not have been sent off in Tottenham's loss to Liverpool if referee John Brooks "did his job" properly, says Spurs boss Thomas Frank.

items.title: Man Utd 'could make January signing' amid Neves link
items.summary: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is possible the club could make a January transfer window signing.

items.title: Brighton & Sunderland's first ever PL match ends in 0-0 draw
items.summary: Brighton's disappointing December run continues as they played out a goalless draw against Sunderland in the Premier League.

items.title: Broja heads home late equaliser for Burnley at Bournemouth
items.summary: Armando Broja heads home a dramatic late equaliser as struggling Burnley end their seven-game losing streak by claiming a precious Premier League point at Bournemouth.

items.title: Haaland scores twice as Man City beat West Ham
items.summary: Erling Haaland scores twice to help Manchester City beat beleaguered West Ham United for a fifth straight Premier League victory which moved them top of the table.

items.title: Liverpool hold on to beat nine-man Spurs
items.summary: Substitute Alexander Isak scores for Liverpool before being forced off with injury as Arne Slot's side win a chaotic Premier League match at nine-man Tottenham.

items.title: Chelsea fight back to claim draw at Newcastle
items.summary: Nick Woltemade scores an early double, but Chelsea fight back to claim a 2-2 draw against Newcastle United at St James' Park.

items.title: Dobey dumped out by Gilding as Bunting progresses
items.summary: World number eight Chris Dobey suffers a shock second round exit at the World Darts Championship with a 3-1 loss to Andrew Gilding.

items.title: Dragons thrash Connacht to end URC winless streak
items.summary: Dragons end their 15-month winless streak in the United Rugby Championship with a thumping 48-28 victory against Connacht at Rodney Parade.

items.title: Semenyo prefers Liverpool move - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo favours move to Liverpool, Bayern Munich ready with offer for Bruno Fernandes, Chelsea looking for buyers for Nicolas Jackson, plus more.

items.title: Lewis-Potter double piles more misery on Wolves
items.summary: Brentford's Keane Lewis-Potter scores twice against Wolves in their 2-0 win at the Molineux.

items.title: Britain's Azim headlines on BBC Two on 31 January
items.summary: British light-welterweight Adam Azim will face Gustavo Lemos on BBC Two and BBC iPlayer on 31 January in London.

items.title: Ruthless Bristol batter Harlequins at Twickenham
items.summary: Bristol produce a scintillating attacking display to batter Harlequins under the lights at Twickenham Stadium.

items.title: Munster rise to second in URC win against Ospreys
items.summary: Munster heap more misery on Ospreys as their United Rugby Championship bonus-point win lifts the Irish province to second in the table.

items.title: 'Do we want to be remembered for fighting or being cowards?'
items.summary: Relegation from the Premier League looks inevitable for Wolves after a 15th defeat in 17 games - but will they avoid setting more unwanted records?

items.title: No fireworks but Glasgow put one hand on 1872 Cup
items.summary: The pre-match pyrotechnics at Hampden Park brought colour and noise, but there was a distinct lack of fireworks when Glasgow and Edinburgh faced off.

items.title: Paul has titanium plates fitted after Joshua breaks his jaw
items.summary: Jake Paul's jaw is broken in two places by Anthony Joshua during their heavyweight fight in Miami.

items.title: Guardiola happy Man City challenging on all fronts
items.summary: Man City boss Pep Guardiola is pleased with the intensity of the pressing of his forward players and his defence as well after his side comfortably beat West Ham 3-0 at the Etihad Stadium.

items.title: Were Newcastle denied 'stonewall' penalty against Chelsea?
items.summary: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe says his side were denied a "stonewall" penalty in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea - so, does he have a point?

items.title: Exeter go top with dramatic late win at Saracens
items.summary: Exeter score three late tries in a fightback to beat Saracens at StoneX Stadium and go top of the Prem table.

items.title: Kildunne scores superb solo try as Quins beat Bristol
items.summary: England star - and BBC Sports Personality of the Year 2025 runner-up - Ellie Kildunne scores a sensational solo try as Harlequins beat Bristol Bears at Allianz Stadium.

items.title: Glenavon stun Linfield as Larne go top for Christmas
items.summary: Champions Linfield lose ground in the Irish Premiership title race as they suffer a shock 2-1 defeat by bottom side Glenavon at Mourneview Park.

items.title: Glasgow secure bonus-point 1872 Cup win over Edinburgh
items.summary: Glasgow Warriors take a big step towards winning the 1872 Cup for the fourth year running with a bonus-point first-leg victory over Edinburgh at Hampden.

items.title: Maresca hints at wanting older heads at end of chaotic week
items.summary: Blues manager Enzo Maresca hints that having some more experience in his squad would be beneficial following their comeback to earn a point at Newcastle.

items.title: Afcon to be held every four years from 2028
items.summary: In a huge change to the football calendar, the Africa Cup of Nations will be held every four years from 2028 - switching away from biennial finals.

items.title: Redknapp runner among King George contenders
items.summary: Fact To File, Gaelic Warrior and Harry Redknapp's The Jukebox Man head the confirmations for the King George VI Chase at Kempton on Boxing Day.

items.title: Vonn claims third podium finish in four races
items.summary: American Lindsey Vonn claims third podium finish in four World Cup races this winter ahead of the 2026 Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics.

items.title: It was hard to recover in Leinster defeat - Murphy
items.summary: Ulster head coach Richie Murphy says there is no time for "wallowing" after losing 24-20 to Leinster in the United Rugby Championship.

items.title: Joshua and Paul earn riches but deliver budget sporting spectacle
items.summary: Anthony Joshua earns one of the biggest paydays of his career - but where does his victory over Jake Paul leave both fighters and boxing?

items.title: Crawley not aware of Stokes' 'weak men' comments
items.summary: Opener Zak Crawley suggests he was not aware of comments made by Ben Stokes when the England captain said his dressing room is "not a place for weak men".

items.title: Stupid or valid? Did Brook's shot put Australia on the brink?
items.summary: Harry Brook's dismissal put England on the brink of Ashes defeat but was his reverse sweep stupid or valid?

items.title: Watch: Joshua knocks out Paul in one-sided fight
items.summary: Anthony Joshua defeats YouTuber-turned-boxer Jake Paul as he secures a comfortable win via a sixth-round stoppage in Miami.

items.title: Salah apologised to Liverpool players - Jones
items.summary: Mohamed Salah's angry outburst is "in the past" and "just part of wanting to be a winner", says his Liverpool team-mate Curtis Jones.

items.title: Could 'massive' Munyua win spark darts boom in Kenya?
items.summary: David Munyua became an instant cult hero at Alexandra Palace on Thursday following a shock win over Mike de Decker at the PDC World Championship.

items.title: Late Lyon wickets put Australia on cusp of Ashes win
items.summary: England are on the brink of an Ashes series defeat after Australia's Nathan Lyon broke their resistance late on the fourth day of the third Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Afcon quiz: Name every Africa Cup of Nations winner
items.summary: With the Africa Cup of Nations kicking off on Sunday, 21 December, can you name every tournament winner?

items.title: 'Give him 24 hours to sign a contract' - Joshua calls out Fury
items.summary: Anthony Joshua says he is ready to take on fellow Briton Tyson Fury in his next fight, after beating Jake Paul.

items.title: Lyon and Cummins put Australia on verge of Ashes victory
items.summary: England are on the brink of an Ashes series defeat after Australia's Nathan Lyon breaks their resistance late on the fourth day of the third Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'Most attacking keeper in league' - why Raya is key for Arsenal
items.summary: David Raya has been described as the most attacking goalkeeper in the league by Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta. BBC Sport analyse the importance of the Spaniard.

items.title: 'Paul was sitting there waiting to get hit' - Lewis leads big-name reaction
items.summary: Former heavyweight champion Lennox Lewis believes Jake Paul 's fitness played a role in his sixth-round stoppage defeat against Anthony Joshua.

items.title: 'Lovely bowling' - Lyon beauty removes Stokes
items.summary: Nathan Lyon gets the better of Ben Stokes with a sharp turning delivery as the England captain is bowled for five, leaving his side on 189-5 on day three of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'Oh no, what's he done?' - Brook bowled after reverse-sweep attempt
items.summary: Nathan Lyon bowls Harry Brook for 30 runs after the England batter's attempt at a reverse sweep is missed, leaving England on 177-4 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Toure 'delighted' to prove doubters wrong
items.summary: Yaya Toure says his motives were scrutinised when he joined Man City, leaving him determined to prove the sceptics wrong.

items.title: 'Absolutely sensational' Labuschagne catch removes Pope
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne reacts sharply to take a brilliant diving catch at second slip to dismiss Ollie Pope for 17, as England fall to 31-2 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: 'He could have left that' - Duckett dismissed early
items.summary: Pat Cummins draws an edge from Ben Duckett as the England batter is caught at second slip by Marnus Labuschagne for four, as the visitors lose their first wicket in the second over of the innings on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Head's 'wonderful' innings edges Australia closer to Ashes victory
items.summary: In front of his home crowd, Travis Head scores 170 to edge Australia closer to retaining the Ashes.

items.title: Carse takes two wickets in two balls
items.summary: Brydon Carse takes the wickets of Pat Cummins and Nathan Lyon in consecutive deliveries as Australia fall to 344-9 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

NASAโs Mars Perseverance rover acquired this image on Dec. 5, 2025 (Sol 1704) at the local mean solar time of 12:33:53, using its onboard Left Navigation Camera (Navcam). The camera is located high on the roverโs mast and aids in driving. NASA/JPL-Caltech Written by Noah Martin, Ph.D. student and Candice Bedford, Research Scientist at Purdue University While much of Perseveranceโs work focuses on ancient rocks that record Marsโ long-lost rivers and lakes, megaripples offer a rare opportunity to examine processes that are still shaping the surface today. items.title: Dubois drops & outclasses Panatta to retain WBC title
items.summary: Caroline Dubois produced a commanding performance on her American debut, outpointing Camilla Panatt to retain her WBC lightweight title in Miami.

items.title: England make breakthrough as Head falls for 170
items.summary: Zak Crawley does well to take a catch in the sun to end Travis Head's brilliant 170-run innings, to leave Australia on 311-5 on day four of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Dortmund beat Monchengladbach to move up to second
items.summary: Borussia Dortmund move up to second in the Bundesliga with a 2-0 win against Borussia Monchengladbach.

items.title: Gurney beats Greaves in deciding set at PDC Worlds
items.summary: Beau Greaves falls just short of becoming the second female player to win a match at the PDC World Championship, losing a deciding set to 22nd seed Daryl Gurney.

items.title: NASA Shares SpaceX Crew-12 Assignments for Space Station Mission
items.summary: As part of NASAโs SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International Space Station for a long-duration science expedition. NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway will serve as spacecraft commander and pโฆ
items.body: From left to right, NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: NASA As part of NASAโs SpaceX Crew-12 mission, four crew members from three space agencies will launch no earlier than Sunday, Feb. 15, 2026, to the International Space Station for a long-duration science expedition. NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway will serve as spacecraft commander and pilot, respectively, and will be accompanied by ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev, who will both serve as mission specialists. Crew-12 will join Expedition 74 crew members currently aboard the space station. The flight is the 12th crew rotation with SpaceX to the orbiting laboratory as part of NASAโs Commercial Crew Program . Crew-12 will conduct scientific investigations and technology demonstrations to help prepare humans for future exploration missions to the Moon and Mars, as well as benefit people on Earth. This will be the second flight to the space station for Meir, who was selected as a NASA astronaut in 2013. The Caribou, Maine, native earned a bachelorโฆ

items.title: NASA Johnsonโs 2025 Milestones
items.summary: NASAโs Johnson Space Center in Houston closed 2025 with major progress across human spaceflight, research, and exploration. From Artemis II mission preparations to science aboard the International Space Station, teams at Johnson helped prepare for future missions to the Moon and, ultimately, Mars. โฆ
items.body: NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston closed 2025 with major progress across human spaceflight, research, and exploration. From Artemis II mission preparations to science aboard the International Space Station, teams at Johnson helped prepare for future missions to the Moon and, ultimately, Mars. Orion Stacked for Artemis II, Orion Mission Evaluation Room Unveiled   NASAโs Artemis II Orion spacecraft with its launch abort system is stacked atop the agencyโs SLS (Space Launch System) rocket in High Bay 3 of the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida on Oct. 20, 2025. NASA/Kim Shiflett As NASA prepares for the crewed Artemis II mission , a 10-day journey around the Moon and back in early 2026, teams at Johnson continue work to ensure the Orion spacecraft is flight-ready. The mission will carry NASA astronauts Reid Wiseman, Victor Glover, Christina Koch, and CSA (Canadian Space Agency) astronaut Jeremy Hansen.  In October, NASA completed stacking of the Orion spacecraft and launch abort system atop the agencyโs SLS (Space Launch System) rocket inside the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASAโs Kennedy Space Center in Florida. Following Orion โฆ

items.title: Water Droplet Science
items.summary: NASA astronaut Don Pettit demonstrates electrostatic forces using charged water droplets and a knitting needle made of Teflon. This series of overlapping frames from Feb. 19, 2025, displays the unique attraction-repulsion properties of Teflon and charged droplets, similar to how charged particles fโฆ
items.body: NASA/Don Pettit NASA astronaut Don Pettit demonstrates electrostatic forces using charged water droplets and a knitting needle made of Teflon. This series of overlapping frames from Feb. 19, 2025, displays the unique attraction-repulsion properties of Teflon and charged droplets, similar to how charged particles from the Sun behave when they come in contact with Earthโs magnetic field. Highly energetic particles from space that collide with atoms and molecules in the atmosphere create the  aurora borealis . Explore more of what Pettit has coined โscience of opportunity.โ Image credit: NASA/Don Pettit

items.title: Fifa owes fans thousands for resold World Cup tickets
items.summary: Customers who resold World Cup tickets on Fifaโs official platform say they are still waiting for thousands of pounds in payments.

items.title: TNT Sports replaces BBC as Commonwealths live broadcaster
items.summary: The subscription channel takes over from the BBC which had been the principal partner since 1954 and provided free-to-air coverage.

items.body: 2 Min Read Metrics Services Catalog Click here to view the FY25 Services Catalog The catalogs provide service description, chargeback rate, unit of measure, and service level indicators for each NSSC service. Service Level Agreement (SLA) Click here to view the Service Level Agreement The SLA provides information about roles, responsibilities, rates, and service level indicators for all NASA Centers. The SLA is negotiated on an annual basis in line with the fiscal year. A single SLA is shared by all NASA Centers and signed by the Associate Administrator, Chief Financial Officer, Chief Information Officer, and the Office of Inspector General. The SLA provides for the delivery of specific services from the NSSC to NASA Centers and Headquarters Operations in the areas of: Financial Management Procurement Human Resources Information Technology Agency Business Services NSSC Bill (Formerly know as Performance and Utilization Report (PUR)) *** On-Line Course Management and Training Purchases have been realigned to the OLC &Training Purchases section of the bill in accordance with the realignment of training funds. Center Special Projects have been consolidated intโฆ

items.title: Hubble Glimpses Galactic Gas Making a Getaway
items.summary: A sideways spiral galaxy shines in this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image. Located about 60 million light-years away in the constellation Virgo (the Maiden), NGC 4388 is a resident of the Virgo galaxy cluster. This enormous cluster of galaxies contains more than a thousand members and is the neโฆ

items.title: Seahawks beat Rams in overtime to seal play-off place
items.summary: The Seattle Seahawks come from behind to beat the Los Angeles Rams in overtime and ensure they will join the Rams in this season's NFL play-offs.

items.title: Betelgeuse and the Crab Nebula: Stellar Death and Rebirth
items.summary: In 2019, Betelgeuse dimmed in brightness, sparking speculation that it may soon explode as a supernova. While it likely wonโt explode quite yet, we can preview its fate by observing the nearby Crab Nebula.
items.body: 3 Min Read Betelgeuse and the Crab Nebula: Stellar Death and Rebirth This highly detailed image of the Crab Nebula was assembled by combining data from five telescopes spanning nearly the entire breadth of the electromagnetic spectrum: The Very Large Array (radio) in red; Spitzer Space Telescope (infrared) in yellow; Hubble Space Telescope (visible) in green; XMM-Newton (ultraviolet) in blue; and Chandra X-ray Observatory (X-ray) in purple. Credits: NASA, ESA, G. Dubner (IAFE, CONICET-University of Buenos Aires) et al.; A. Loll et al.; T. Temim et al.; F. Seward et al.; VLA/NRAO/AUI/NSF; Chandra/CXC; Spitzer/JPL-Caltech; XMM-Newton/ESA; and Hubble/STScI What happens when a star dies? In 2019, Betelgeuse dimmed in brightness , sparking speculation that it may soon explode as a supernova. While it likely wonโt explode quite yet, we can preview its fate by observing the nearby Crab Nebula. A view of the constellations Orion and Taurus, along with notable features: Betelgeuse in Orion, and Aldebaran and the Crab Nebula in Taurus. Stellarium Web Betelgeuse is easy to find as the red-hued shoulder star of Orion. A variable star, Betelgeuse, usually competes with the brilliant blue-whiteโฆ

items.title: Head scores unbeaten century to leave England on brink of Ashes defeat

items.title: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4743-4749:ย Polygons in the Hollow
items.summary: Written by Lucy Lim, Planetary Scientist at NASAโs Goddard Space Flight Center Earth Planning Date: Friday, Dec. 12, 2025 The weekend drive starting from the โNevado Sajamaโ drill site brought Curiosity back into the โMonte Grandeโ boxwork hollow. Weโve been in this hollow before for the โValle de โฆ
items.body: Curiosity Navigation Curiosity Home Mission Overview Where is Curiosity? Mission Updates Science Overview Instruments Highlights Exploration Goals News and Features Multimedia Curiosity Raw Images Images Videos Audio Mosaics More Resources Mars Missions Mars Sample Return Mars Perseverance Rover Mars Curiosity Rover MAVEN Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter Mars Odyssey More Mars Missions Mars Home 3 min read Curiosity Blog, Sols 4743-4749: Polygons in the Hollow NASAโs Mars rover Curiosity acquired this close-up image of polygon-shaped features in the โMonte Grandeโ boxwork hollow. Similar polygonal patterns in various strata were seen previously, elsewhere in Gale Crater. Curiosity captured the image using its Mars Hand Lens Imager (MAHLI), located on the turret at the end of the roverโs robotic arm, on Dec. 11, 2025 โ Sol 4745, or Martian day 4,745 of the Mars Science Laboratory mission โ at 16:55:37 UTC.
